intro: Stimpsonia chamaedryoides f. rubriflora, commonly known as the red-flowered form of the stimpsonia, is a rare and striking plant native to specific regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its compact, mat-forming growth habit. The plant features small, hairy leaves and produces showy, bright red flowers that bloom in spring. Its ornamental value is largely due to its vibrant floral display and unique coloration. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is often cultivated in botanical gardens and by enthusiasts.
